_header: The mother full mannerly and meekly as a maid
Note:
See Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 1570.
Subjects: Virgin Mary, songs in honour of
_description: A moralization on the Virgin Mary playing with the Christ Child — three monorhyming quatrains and 4-line Latin burden: ‘Quid petis O fili…’

CamPeter195.Transcription:
O mater quid fili pete me dulcissime babaO pater O fili mihi
                        plausus oscula dada

BLAdd31922.First Lines: The moder full manerly & mekly as a maydlokyng on her lytill son so laughyng in lap layd…
BLAdd31922.Last Lines: …yet softly to her swet son me thought I hard her saynenow gracius god & gode swete babe yet ous þis game agayne
BLAdd31922.Note: Words and notation repeated for three voices.
